skillTree.localised_description: There are some deals that it would be extremely unwise to renege on…
Brunner always carries a blessed stake with him, for an occasional encounter with a Vampire is inevitable in his line of work.

Brunner often takes contracts from Judge Vaulkberg, a particularly ruthless Imperial Judge who passes sentences hastily, paying huge sums of money to mercenaries like Brunner to bring outlaws and bandits to justice without a care as to the means. Vaulkberg sometimes sends his personal Ogre executioner, Lump, to ensure justice is properly served.

effects.description: A new follower will be added: Vaulkberg's Aid

ui_effects.localised_text: Judge Vaulkberg's executioner will come to your aid

skillTree.localised_description: After a chance encounter with writer Erhard Stoeker, Brunner captured the novelist’s mind with stories of his deeds; from slaying the dreaded Black Prince, to besting the rival bounty hunter Krogh, to dealing with several factions in the ruined city of Mousillon warring over the draconic relic known as the Fell Fang.

effects.description: A new follower will be added: Erhard the Chronicler

Global recruitment duration: -1 turn for all units
	(accompanying Lord)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: A man such as Brunner receives contracts almost daily. He usually handles only one at a time; however, given how long his current contract is, he has made an exception this time.

effects.description: Contracts will be issued every 10 turns

skillTree.localised_description: Brunner is prepared for any sort of vile creature he might encounter in his travels, carrying an assortment of knives and swords.
Brunner always weighs his options, and if a situation becomes difficult to control, he will retreat and continue the chase once he has regained the advantage.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

skillTree.localised_description: The bounty hunter is always watching his surroundings, even when he appears otherwise. In fact, he makes an effort to appear inattentive. As a result, it is a challenge to catch Brunner off guard.

effects.description: This character becomes able to see enemies hiding in forest regardless of distance

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

skillTree.localised_description: Though most of his contracts are situated within Bretonnia, Tilea and the Empire and Border Prince Confederacy, Brunner’s contracts have taken him all over the Old World.

effects.description: Diplomacy: +5 with The Empire, Bretonnia, Kislev and Southern Realms
Diplomacy: +10 with The Empire, Bretonnia, Kislev and Southern Realms
Diplomacy: +15 with The Empire, Bretonnia, Kislev and Southern Realms

skillTree.localised_description: Brunner’s true identity is revealed…

effects.description: XP Gain: +15% when fighting against Bretonnia

Income from post-battle loot: +10% when fighting against Bretonnia
	(factionwide)

Magic item drop chance: +10% when fighting against Bretonnia
	(factionwide)
A dilemma between two choices will be given to you

skillTree.localised_description: So much of war is an art. Over time and with much practice, combat moves can resemble a series of perfectly-rehearsed dance moves.
This being fights dirty, no honour system applies here!
"Stay in one place, gods-damn you!"
Whether a targeted slice to the throat, or a precision stab to the heart, this one knows how to kill!
"The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
This one doesn't just move in the shadows, they *are* the shadows…
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
Always on the lookout for an opening or advantage in battle - somewhere to put the knife in…
The harder they hit, the more they commit, the easier it is to strike back.
A drawn blade should not be put away until slaked in blood.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: You have to get up very early if you want to beat this one; nothing escapes their keen eye and lightning reflexes.
The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.
Although precision in missile combat is something that can be learned, this one was born with a high degree of natural talent.
Brunner uses a special kind of ammunition that is condemned by others in his field. His preferred munition is Wyrdstone, or Warpstone, well known for driving its regular users mad.
Taken from a Skaven who tried to double-cross Brunner. The bounty hunter has since used the crossbow to great effect.

effects.description: A weapon variant will be given: Repeater Crossbows

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Taken as a trophy from a Bretonnian mercenary hired to kill him. Brunner uses this bow sparingly.

effects.description: A weapon variant will be given: Asrai Bow

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can fire while on the move.

skillTree.localised_description: An Imperial handgun augmented with a blade at the stock, inspired by the weapon of a Kislevite associate whom Brunner has worked with many times.

effects.description: A weapon variant will be given: Modified Handgun

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Alongside his collection of blades, Brunner also carries a few pistols with him in case a situation calls for them.

effects.description: A weapon variant will be given: Pistol & Sword

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit can fire while on the move.

skillTree.localised_description: "I am not here to inspire, I am here to kill - come let us draw blades together!"

effects.description: Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 3%
Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 8%
Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: Whether it be training harder, travelling lighter, eating less or sleeping better, there's always a way to draw more from the day.

effects.description: Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 5%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 10%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

effects.description: Assault Garrison action: Additional 5% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 30% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

items.colour_text:
Brunner carries with him the family weapon of the Von Drakenburgs, Drakesmalice. The Von Drakenburgs were an Imperial noble house who were recently massacred by a vengeful Bretonnian Viscount. Brunner claimed it when he killed the traitor Seneschal of the now-extinct family, who had fled to the Border Princes with the sword as a trophy.  The blade bursts into bright flame when brandished; it is rumoured that only a Von Drakenburg may ignite the sword. Curiously, it burns for Brunner.
	
	Brunner also carries a large serrated knife for beheading targets. The head is then preserved in a bag of salt until delivered to the proper authorities.
Brunner dons a blackened breastplate of Gromril, the toughest and sturdiest metal in the world.

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

items.colour_text: A cunning Tilean device, secreted in the sleeve, that can be thrown at moderate distance. Taken from the body of Ursio, a Tilean mercenary.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

items.colour_text: A tooth of the dragon Malok, carved into a flute and enchanted by the exiled Grey Lords, who were High Elven princes and mages exiled from Ulthaun after the Sundering, when they used this powerful artefact to enslave the dragons of Caledor. Using the Fell Fang can prove lethal, and thus Brunner has opted to save it for a desperate situation.

ui_effects.localised_text: The legendary Malok the Destroyer will heed your call

items.colour_text: Brunner often takes contracts from Judge Vaulkberg, a particularly ruthless Imperial Judge who passes sentences hastily, paying huge sums of money to mercenaries like Brunner to bring outlaws and bandits to justice without a care as to the means. Vaulkberg sometimes sends his personal Ogre executioner, Lump, to ensure justice is properly served.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: One of the most well-known and renowned bounty hunters of the Old World, Brunner has been regularly employed by Imperial and Bretonnian nobility and the dozens of princes and petty kings of the Southern Realms, sometimes working under the alias Habermas for contracts in places where he is not welcome.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead
